intro: Mammillaria subangularis, commonly known as the Angular Mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines and small, rounded tubercles. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 centimeters and produces yellow flowers during the spring or early summer. It prefers well-draining soil and full sun exposure, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation. Due to its compact size and distinctive appearance, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
